title: The Human as a System Component
content: Humans are essential system components with predictable capabilities and limitations. Unlike machines, humans excel at pattern recognition, adaptation, and judgment—but have limited attention, imperfect memory, and systematic biases. Effective operations design around human strengths while mitigating human limitations.

mcq.question: Why is understanding human limitations essential for operational safety?

options.B: To design systems and procedures that account for predictable human performance
options.C: To identify who to blame when errors occur
options.D: Human limitations can be trained away

mcq.explanation: Human limitations are predictable, not personal failings. Systems designed assuming perfect human performance will fail. Accounting for limitations—through automation, procedures, cross-checks—creates reliability despite imperfection.

openQuestions: What human limitations most frequently affect your operations?
How does your operation design around known human limitations?
